title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 317.7 - Failure of applicant to appear
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 317.7 - Failure of applicant to appear

State Regulations
(a) The failure of the applicant or his or her attorney to appear at an initial
hearing without a timely and proper adjournment pursuant to section
317.5
of this Part will result in a
dismissal of the application for failure to prosecute. (b) After an initial hearing is held, failure
to appear without an adjournment or waiver of appearance will result in the
applicant's case being closed. The retirement system reserves the right to
present its case. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 2
ยง
317.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
